pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fd2a53576f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17013/commits/fd2a53576feb6feacacefa54ccf02d55ecbdabb5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Right.pow_neg`
`+ Right.pow_nonneg`
`+ Right.pow_nonpos`
`+ one_le_pow_of_le`
`+ pow_le_one_of_le`
`+ pow_lt_one_of_lt`
`+ pow_neg`
`+ pow_nonneg`
`+ pow_nonpos`
`+ pow_right_monotone`
`- Left.one_le_pow_of_le`
`- Left.pow_le_one_of_le`
`- Left.pow_lt_one_of_lt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@YaelDillies There are some duplicate lemmas in this file. I moved them close to each other. Do you have a preference about which ones should be deprecated?
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11008868301/job/30567336815)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11008868301/job/30567336470)

The pattern used in earlier files is to have the lemmas in the `Left` namespace be aliased in the root namespace. For the specific lemmas here, I have argued before that it would be nice to find a typeclass that abstracts both the `Left` and `Right` lemmas (it's pretty specific to `pow`/`zpow` since we're relying on the fact that going to the multiplicativ opposite doesn't change `pow`/`zpow`). However, it might be overengineering for what's ultimately a series of a few lemmas.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Monoid/Unbundled/Pow): cleanup

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fd2a53576f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17013/commits/fd2a53576feb6feacacefa54ccf02d55ecbdabb5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Right.pow_neg`
`+ Right.pow_nonneg`
`+ Right.pow_nonpos`
`+ one_le_pow_of_le`
`+ pow_le_one_of_le`
`+ pow_lt_one_of_lt`
`+ pow_neg`
`+ pow_nonneg`
`+ pow_nonpos`
`+ pow_right_monotone`
`- Left.one_le_pow_of_le`
`- Left.pow_le_one_of_le`
`- Left.pow_lt_one_of_lt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@YaelDillies There are some duplicate lemmas in this file. I moved them close to each other. Do you have a preference about which ones should be deprecated?

The pattern used in earlier files is to have the lemmas in the `Left` namespace be aliased in the root namespace. For the specific lemmas here, I have argued before that it would be nice to find a typeclass that abstracts both the `Left` and `Right` lemmas (it's pretty specific to `pow`/`zpow` since we're relying on the fact that going to the multiplicativ opposite doesn't change `pow`/`zpow`). However, it might be overengineering for what's ultimately a series of a few lemmas.
